prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. Draw a sketch on face_1 of the coordinate system. Create loop_1 on the sketch with the following curves: * line_1: Start Point (0.0, 0.0), End Point (0.5471, 0.0) * line_2: Start Point (0.5471, 0.0), End Point (0.5471, 0.4026) * line_3: Start Point (0.5471, 0.4026), End Point (0.0, 0.4026) * line_4: Start Point (0.0, 0.4026), End Point (0.0, 0.0) Close the loop. Extrude the sketch by 0.0366 towards the normal direction and 0.0 in the opposite direction. Apply a sketch scale of 0.5471 to the sketch before extrusion. This will create a new body as a result. The final shape of part 1 will be a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The height of the part is half the length of the sides (0.0366m), the length and width are both 0.5471m. **Part 2: Construct a cylinder with a flat top and bottom** Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and a translation vector of 0.3475, 0.0, 0.0. Draw a sketch on face_1 of the coordinate system. Create loop_1 on the sketch with one circle: * circle_1: Center (0.2013, 0.2013), Radius 0.2013 Close the loop. Extrude the sketch by 0.1247 towards the normal direction and 0.0 in the opposite direction. Apply a sketch scale of 0.4025 to the sketch before extrusion. This will join the current body with the previous body. The final shape of part 2 will be a cylinder with a flat top and bottom. The height of the part is approximately twice the diameter (0.1246m), the length and width are both 0.4025m. **Part 3: Construct a cylinder with a tapered top and flat bottom** Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and a translation vector of 0.4063, 0.0588, 0.1247. Draw a sketch on face_1 of the coordinate system. Create loop_1 on the sketch with one circle: * circle_1: Center (0.1425, 0.1425), Radius 0.1425 Close the loop. Extrude the sketch by 0.0 towards the normal direction and 0.3203 in the opposite direction. Apply a sketch scale of 0.2849 to the sketch before extrusion. This will cut the current body from the previous body. The final shape of part 3 will be a cylinder with a tapered top and flat bottom. The top is slightly wider than the bottom. The height of the part is 0.3203m, the length and width are both 0.2849m. **Combined shape: Construct a cylindrical object with a rectangular hole in the center** The above three parts, after being combined, will form the final CAD model as described in the CAD Assembly JSON: a cylindrical object with a rectangular hole in the center. The dimensions of the hole will align with the dimensions of part 1. The height of the hole will be equal to the sum of the heights of parts 1 and 2, while the length and width of the hole will be the same as those of part 1.</description>
